revised_title: Coral Skeletal Chemistry: Understanding Environmental and Physiological Regulation
tldr: The study investigates the physiological and environmental regulation of stable isotopes and trace metals in the coral Montastrea annularis. The research reveals strong seasonal variations in 13C and magnesium contents, which are linked to changes in growth rate. The findings indicate that metabolic effects cannot be ignored in paleo-environmental interpretation of carbonate skeletal chemistry, and stable isotopes are useful tools in understanding overall carbon metabolism of photosynthetic calcifying organisms.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Coral Reef Ecology
